intro: Lithocarpus dealbatus subsp. leucostachyus, commonly known as the white-stemmed stone栎, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks and chestnuts, and is characterized by its hard, woody fruit. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical forests, preferring well-drained soils and partial to full shade. Its leaves are革质 (leathery) and elliptical in shape, while the flowers are small and inconspicuous, with male and female flowers occurring on separate plants. The subspecies is distinguished by its pale, often whitish bark and its unique fruit morphology.
